snippet: In the middle of the last decade, the number of miles driven — both over all and per capita — began to drop, notes a report to be published on Tuesday by a nonprofit advocacy organization.
abstract: Report by nonprofit advocacy group US Pirg finds that Americans are cutting back on driving, and that shift is being led by younger generation; shows that number of miles driven--both over all and per capita--began to drop nationwide in mid-2000s, reversing trend of mileage growth over previous six decades.
lead_paragraph: In the middle of the last decade, the number of miles driven — both over all and per capita — began to drop, notes a report to be published on Tuesday by a nonprofit advocacy organization.

headline.seo: Report Finds Americans Are Driving Less, Led by Youth
headline.main: Young Americans Lead Trend to Less Driving
headline.print_headline: Young Americans Lead Trend to Less Driving
